system.description:
Specializations: Leader’s unit — type of troops (guards, soldiers, cavalry, etc.)

Command is a measure of a character’s ability to convince gamemaster characters and subordinates to do what they’re told. Command generally shouldn’t be used against other player characters to force them to do something against their will — these situations should be handled through roleplaying interaction.

A high command roll can complement individual participants’ rolls in a group activity, while a low command roll can impose negative modifiers. It generally requires at least one round of planning to perform effectively.

The skill is often used in combat situations, such as a squad leader commanding his troops or a Battleship captain telling his gunners which enemy ship to target.

When a character uses command, determine a difficulty number.
• Very Easy: Characters have every reason to obey. 
• Easy: Characters have some reason to obey.
• Moderate: Characters have no reason to disobey.
• Difficult: Characters are skeptical or suspicious.
• Very Difficult: Characters have every reason to be suspicious.
• Heroic: Characters have no reason at all to listen to you.

Command is also used when coordinating projects with many workers, such as manufacturing ships in space dock and other complex operations. See the  sections on “Combined Actions” in the chapter on “The Rules.”
